text:
In order to be consistent with the manifest task, the default encoding of the manifest should be UTF-8.

A jar manifest should always be encoded as UTF-8 (Jar specification).
See also http://bugs.sun.com/view_bug.do?bug_id=5067559

The manifest encoding options ("manifestencoding" in "jar" task and "encoding" in "manifest" task) create some confusion, giving the impression that the manifest can be encoded using any arbitrary encoding (might be true for ant, but not for Java). 

The encoding options should be presented as a convenience mechanism to avoid encoding conversion of MANIFEST.MF templates.  It should also be clearly documented that MANIFEST.MF encoding should be UTF-8. 

The encoding options could also become deprecated to avoid further confusion.
creator: gawix@yahoo.com

text:
svn revision 805297 changes the manual to clearly state that Ant will always write UTF-8.  Ant is in conformance with the spec and I don't really see any problem.

The attributes are there only for the reading end and there may be good reasons why existing manifest templates are not in UTF-8 (today less so than five years ago, though).
